poem:
### Silence in the Forecast

In the cloistered halls of weather,  
the voice of earth is stilled.  
Bureaucratic bindings coil  
around the truth, tight-  
lipped winds murmur  
their dismay. Science,  
in chains, watches  
clouds form  
without the  
whispered words  
to tell the storm's  
approach. In  
quiet, we stand  
lost amid the  
forests of  
our own making.
